headline: Lyon drug traffickers hire Colombian hitmen to kill their rivals
description: Criminal cases involving Colombian nationals have become increasingly common in the Lyon area. According to the police, these individuals are believed to be mercenaries hired by French drug trafficking kingpins to terrorize or eliminate their rivals.

headline: 2030 Alps Games already facing storm of internal controversies and public backlash
Death of Fredrick Brennan, creator of 8chan forum where QAnon emerged
Giorgia Meloni's strong poll numbers, a deceptive success
description: Although 71% of Italians believe their country is headed in the 'wrong direction,' Italy's prime minister, Giorgia Meloni, continues to enjoy significant public trust. High voter abstention, an aging electorate and a divided opposition contribute to this apparent paradox.

headline: Dozens of troops dead in Mexican violence after drug kingpin killed
description: Violent clashes erupted after the death of Nemesio 'El Mencho' Oseguera, leader of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG), was announced on Sunday, following a shootout with soldiers.

headline: The 'impossible' task of counting deaths at sea
description: The International Organization for Migration and migrant aid NGOs simultaneously record deaths at sea in the Mediterranean and Atlantic, but often come up with very different figures. Why?

headline: With expected US retreat, Germany seeks to strengthen its role within NATO
description: Berlin has invested hundreds of billions of euros to rearm since Russia's invasion of Ukraine in 2022 and aims to play a major role within the North Atlantic Alliance, particularly as the US moves toward isolation.

headline: Ukraine's Western allies push to drag the war out
France to revoke US envoy Kushner's government access after no-show
Dark Bank: American suspected of leading an international criminal organization extradited to France
Susan George, French-American political scientist and figure of the alter-globalization movement, dies
Paris municipal elections: Socialist candidate Grégoire holds his own debate with Parisians
New election rules spice up Paris, Marseille and Lyon mayor races
French court to rule on Sarkozy request for shortened prison time
Understanding the battle of Verdun through rare or little-known photographs
French artist JR's installation will transform Paris's oldest bridge into a giant cave
Donald Trump's support with 'bro culture' is waning
France aims to protect children from chatbots
India, the world's leading dairy producer, struggles to rid its market of adulterated milk
AI has arrived in France's local elections – for better or worse
description: From creating campaign videos to writing speeches, artificial intelligence has become an effective tool for candidates. However, it also raises ethical questions, prompting some elected officials to call for regulation.

headline: The Ukrainian family torn by war and exile behind a famous photo published by Le Monde
description: A few days after the Russian invasion, photojournalist Laurence Geai captured the farewell of a Ukrainian family at Odesa train station. Four years later, the mother welcomed Le Monde to Cologne, Germany, where she lives as a refugee with her son and her mother, far from her husband, since enlisted in the army.

headline: Serge Gainsbourg's forgotten Ukrainian roots
description: Serge Gainsbourg described himself as a Russian Jew. More precisely, his musician parents fled Tsarist Ukraine before emigrating to Paris in 1921, to escape from pogroms and the Bolsheviks. In Ukraine, where four years of war have fueled an obsession with uncovering traces of the past, some have been trying to rediscover the singer's roots.

headline: Vladimir Putin, trapped by his own logic of war
'What is, ultimately, the point of sending humans into space?'
Tariffs: 'Donald Trump has just learned the hard way: In the United States, the law is king'
